subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A good deed by:  Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: black bear hollow
full_text:
Why 2 groups... because the 2 descriptions of each group are so  
radically different. In my own experience with the one group, and what  
other spirits have told me about them, I tend to think, there are 2  
groups.

The group that Sandra talks about is very helpful, but she doesn't  
have enough info. on her site for me to actually examine the group she  
dealt with. Mr. Smith (AAEVP) refers to them as demons. I'm not sure  
I'd go that far, but yeah, ok - my experience was fairly nasty. Was  
that because they are so called "demons" which I think is a ridiculous  
term btw, or just immature, yet very clever spirits who get a kick out  
of causing trouble - or trying to? I just don't know.

 From hearing both descriptions, I'd say there may be 2 groups or  
maybe only one "real" Fish Group and another band of roving nasty  
spiritual beasties who want you to think they're the Fish Group to  
give them an "in" to talk to you - invade your world so to speak.

If they said they were a band of crazy demons, would you talk to them?  
lol! :D
But if they said they're the Fish Group, I'd be like OH! Ok, let's see  
what they say...

w.
On Aug 18, 2008, at 2:22 PM, Lisby wrote:

> Don't you think it's more likely that they're both? I always try to  
> follow the crime investigation maxim that the simplest explanation  
> is the most likely. Why should there be two groups? Why not just one  
> full of anarchists, loyal neither to black or white? Most everything  
> in this world falls into the area of gray. I think it's therefore  
> likely that this is true of the next.
